title: Xbox Boss Phil Spencer Isn’t Really Sold On Mid-Cycle Upgrades Like PS5 Pro: ‘It’s Harder To Show The Benefits’
text: Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer has cast doubt on the need for a mid-cycle console upgrade due to the advancements in technology. Speaking with Rolling Stone, Spencer was asked if Microsoft has any similar plans to Sony’s own mid-cycle refresh, the recently-launched PS5 Pro, but suggested it’s hard to show the benefits these days as consoles are far more technologically capable than the transition from standard to high-definition. Does a new device really give you a unique experience on screen in some way? [It’s] less like the old days, going from the original Xbox to 360; that was standard definition to high definition. Now, [it’s] harder to show the benefits. Related Content — Upcoming PS5 Games 2024: The Best PS5 Games Coming Soon Microsoft has released a mid-cycle upgrade in the past during the Xbox One era, with the Xbox One X offering a more power under the hood similar to what Sony did during the same generation via PS4 Pro. The company has Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S available on the market for the current cycle, with the former the more powerful version of the system. The PS5 Pro was released on November 7, 2024 priced at $699.99/£699.99. You can read our full hardware review for Sony’s latest console here. Source – [Rolling Stone]
